item.title: The tree outside our house is far too large and needs pruning., 24th June
item.description:
Outside 8 Wanstead Road, Bromley BR13BL. The tree outside our property is in need of urgent pruning. It has been left for far too long and has grown far too large . I fear that if left at its current size my property is at risk of damage should the tree fall during a storm or strong winds. I request that the tree is pruned as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wanstead Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins in bin area, 24th June
item.description:
The rubbish in the bin area in King House, Matthias Road, has not been collected for 2 weeks and the rubbish is overflowing. There is an ant infestation here. It’s dirty and it smells. When will this be collected please?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Matthias Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Completely broken and unsafe springy thing in play area, 23rd June
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish, litter, Nitrous Oxide in Perran Road, 23rd June
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting woke up to find rubbish scattered all over the street on Monday morning , the bin collection day and find the road in same disgusting condition in the evening scattered with rubbish. Plastic labels, yoghurt pot etc. Nitrous Oxide Cannisters found around bins , plants and trees on the road!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatham Hill, London

item.title: Human faeces outside my home, 23rd June
item.description:
Somebody has used the pavement outside my home as a toilet. They were spotted by a neighbour leaving human faeces on the floor. This is the second time this has happened on Queen’s Drive within two weeks. Thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins and ripped bin bags of rubbish, 23rd June
item.description:
This is a constant problem. By the BA bus stop / estate agents and also outside the chicken takeaway shop. Bins overflowing with rubbish . Bags of waste left next to the bins are ripped open by foxes with rubbish strewn down Westcombe Hill. Why do local residents / businesses not have sufficient bins provided to hold their refuse until collected? Makes the area look dirty and has to be unhealthy in this heat. Obstructs the bus stop. Needs cleaning up daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 186, Westcombe Hill, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover seriously loose, 23rd June
item.description:
It sounds like a shogun when driven over and its been like this for months. It must be dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20,20A, Maylands Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
